scenarioDescription:
The GJ 179 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 179 is a star with 0.36 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.38 times its radius. It is located 40.30 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 179 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 179 system


GJ 179 b

GJ 179 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2010-10, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.41 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 179 b is 260.760 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 179 b is 13.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, GJ 179 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 179, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: GJ 179 - System With 1 Exoplanet
